ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: True and I haven t dealt with them on a high level zone scale (my highest char being 23).  But it seems the other big guilds don t  have much of a problem with
ygData.messageBody:
True and I haven't dealt with them on a high level zone scale (my
highest char being 23). But it seems the other big guilds don't have
much of a problem with FOH, and they seemed to have come up with a
pretty good system of sharing it.

From what i know, guild XXXX lets FOH know they want to kill yyyyyy (or
invade plane zzzzz), FOH gives them 24 hours (after it spawns) to do it,
if not they go in and do it. It sounds pretty reasonable to me as they
reall have enough firepower to easily do both dragons after a respawn,
before any other guild gets organized enough to do it.

Some guild got angry the FOH wouldn't share their techniques for
breaking the planes or killing the dragons easily (when these things
weren't commonly known), but I don't have a problem with that. I think
they have a right to keep those "secrets" to themselves.

Veeshan is a weird server, it has a VERY high percentage of Japanese
players, so that always makes things a little testy (since there is
basically no communication). Population wise (especially pre-split) it
was truly bizarre. Veeshan would be 20% more crowded than any server in
the middle of night, early morning (Eastern time), but in prime time
(Easterern still) it would be around average.

"Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" wrote:
>
> we get the same thing on our server, as i am sure every "uber-guild" (stupid
> term) does on their respective servers. i don't think anyone is quite as
> large or has quite the attitude that FoH apparently does though. i think
> they have 300 or so members, so they can really take over a large portion of
> the high level game from other players. we have about 65 members or so, and
> we can do dragons and planes at our leisure as well, but we work very well
> with the other guilds on the server capable of doing these. i don't believe
> that is the case with FoH. i have no first-hand experience but from what i
> hear they deserve their rep, but i guess only those who have dealt with them
> personally can know.
>
> ok bragging time, we killed Venril Sathir first =b
>
--
We now return to the non-stop rock.

Matt DeBarger
